author: sky.cactus
content: <@!396163506757435403> I personally would love to simply *delete* any information that is duplicated and replace the deleted content with a link to some other primary source.  Anywhere we are maintaining the same info in multiple places (like the list of statuses) it is bound to become out of date (like the list of statuses).

author: poojaranjan
content:
> I haven’t done the pull request for the eip ip # 20 notes, yet, but there is a preview, here:
> https://github.com/BrentAllsop/EIPIP/blob/master/All%20EIPIP%20Meetings/Meeting%20020.md
> Jim skipped much of the duplicate stuff in first and second hour, after non time change people showed up an hour late.  We just included the decisions made, and a summary of the important stuff said.
> Also, Micah had some great information about what is required to push an EIP forward.  This is in the notes, but where could we copy this to make it more permanent?
> If I don’t hear of any issues, I’ll do the pull request.
<@!396163506757435403> I think it will be valuable to add (item 2) questions  brought up from the EIP survey. The discussion turned out to be good FAQ for people who missed the meeting. Also,  we made a decision of merging PR to EIP-1 wrt  (item1) proliferation of EIP statuses. It'd make sense to capture that discussion in notes.

author: poojaranjan
content: Re: place holder for decisions to be more permanent.  I think the Cat Herders blog on EIP new statuses and process could be a place holder for them for a quick reference. (open to other suggestions)
